meanings.definition: A person who is unwilling to spend money; a miser.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is such a skinflint that he never buys anything new.
meanings.sent2: The skinflint refused to contribute to the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The skinflint's wallet screamed in agony every time he opened it.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as a skinflint spread faster than wildfire in our small town.
meanings.sent5: The image of the skinflint counting every penny was etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: To be stingy or miserly in spending money.
meanings.sent1: I try not to skinflint when it comes to treating my friends to lunch.
meanings.sent2: She would always skinflint on buying gifts for her family.
meanings.sent3: The millionaire decided to skinflint on his own birthday party, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The company's decision to skinflint on employee benefits led to low morale.
meanings.sent5: Don't skinflint on investing in your education; it's worth every penny.
